title: 103_hr4648
content: The "Public Pension Parity Act of 1994" is introduced to amend the Internal Revenue Code by excluding certain pensions and annuities under public retirement systems. The "Public Pension Parity Act of 1994" amends the Internal Revenue Code to exclude qualified governmental pensions from an individual's gross income. There are limitations on the amount that can be excluded, based on social security benefits and service requirements. The "Public Pension Parity Act of 1994" excludes qualified governmental pensions from gross income, with limitations based on social security benefits and service requirements. Qualified governmental pension refers to pensions not attributable to certain types of employment or covered by a Social Security Act agreement. The maximum excludable social security benefits are defined as a portion of the applicable maximum benefit amount for the taxpayer for the taxable year. The "Public Pension Parity Act of 1994" excludes qualified governmental pensions from gross income based on social security benefits. The applicable maximum benefit amount varies depending on marital status, with different percentages of the maximum individual social security benefit. The "Public Pension Parity Act of 1994" excludes qualified governmental pensions from gross income based on social security benefits. The maximum individual social security benefit is the highest total amount payable for old-age insurance benefits in a calendar year to an individual aged 65 or older. The "Public Pension Parity Act of 1994" excludes qualified governmental pensions from gross income for individuals receiving less than a full taxable year. The maximum individual social security benefit is adjusted accordingly. The term "public retirement system" refers to pension funds established by the government entities. A technical amendment is made to the tax code regarding modified adjusted gross income. The tax code is amended by inserting section 137 before section 911, and a clerical amendment is made to the table of sections for part III of subchapter B of chapter 1. The amendments made by this Act regarding certain pensions and annuities under public retirement systems will apply to taxable years beginning after the enactment date of this Act.
